meanings.definition: Break or fail to comply with (a rule or law)
meanings.sent1: He knew it was wrong to violate the speed limit.
meanings.sent2: The company was fined for violating environmental regulations.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly said she would violate the 'no dessert' rule.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti on the wall seemed to violate the silence of the night.
meanings.sent5: The loud music violated the peaceful atmosphere of the library.

meanings.definition: Treat with disrespect or disregard for personal boundaries
meanings.sent1: It is never okay to violate someone's privacy.
meanings.sent2: The bully continued to violate the student's personal space.
meanings.sent3: He didn't mean to violate your trust; it was an accident.
meanings.sent4: The paparazzi seemed to violate the actress's privacy at every turn.
meanings.sent5: The hacker's actions clearly violate online etiquette.

meanings.sent1: The loud construction noise would violate the tranquility of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: Please do not violate the peacefulness of the meditation room.
meanings.sent3: The barking dog seemed determined to violate the calm of the night.
meanings.sent4: The sudden thunderstorm seemed to violate the serenity of the picnic.
meanings.sent5: The car alarm continued to violate the silence of the street.
